questions.question: What hero captained the Argo on the quest for the Golden Fleece?
What goddess, born parthogenically from Zeus’ head, was the goddess of wisdom, strategic warfare, and domestic crafts, and was depicted with a spear, the aegis, olives, and an owl?
What kind of animal was Pegasus?
What god of warfare was represented by dogs and woodpeckers, was the son of Hera and Zeus, and had an affair with Aphrodite?
What was the Roman name for the Greek god Thanatos?
Which of the following was NOT a river in the Underworld?

What woman had to perform impossible tasks for Venus, such as separating thousands of grains, gathering golden fleece from fierce rams, collecting the water of the river Styx, and entering the Underworld to obtain a box of beauty from Proserpina ?
Which Titan accepted a gift from the gods, Pandora, who had been created by Hephaestus and given many enticing attributes by the other gods?
What Roman woodland god presided over plowmen and woodcutters?
Which one of these groups helped Zeus defeat the Titans?
What story did Hermes tell Argus to make the guardian fall asleep?

options.B: The creation of man from stone (Deucalion)
options.D: The invention of the Syrinx pipes

questions.question: According to Ovid, which of the following did NOT occur when Orpheus sang to Pluto and Proserpina in the Underworld?

options.A: Sisyphus sat still on his rock

questions.question: On what island, sacred to Aphrodite, did Pygmalion and Galatea live?
What man did the Argonauts defend against the Harpies?
Who was told by the seer Polyidus to sleep in Athena’s temple to learn how to capture a fabulous animal?
What son of Minos’ death began the Athenian tribute to Crete that Theseus ended?
Which monster did Heracles defeat, but NOT as one of his 12 labors demanded by Eurystheus?
Who bribed Myrtilus to sabotage the chariot race for Hippodameia’s hand?
What ability did Poseidon grant Mestra so that she could help her father Erysichthon feed his insatiable hunger?

options.B: Seeing into the earth for treasure
options.D: Instantly growing wine, olives, and grain

questions.question: What Trojan prince was the lover of Aurora, father of Memnon, and changed into a grasshopper?
What priestess of Hera was the mother of Biton and Cleobis?
Who were the parents of Orestes, Iphigenia, and Electra ?
What son of Zeus and Aegina prayed to have his island repopulated by men created from ants after Hera devastated his land with a plague?
What god’s other names or epithets were Aidoneus, Eubouleus, and Zeus Katachthonios?
What group, said to be the daughters of either Nyx or of Zeus and Themis, were also called Moirai?
What two children escaped from certain death by flying on the back of a golden ram?
What three sisters resisted the worship of Dionysus, were driven mad, tore apart one sister’s son, Hippasus, and were eventually turned into bats?
According to Euripides’ Orestes, what woman arrived in Argos on the day of Orestes’ trial, only to be
What ability as a priestess of Hecate did Medea claim to have to the daughters of Pelias?

options.A: She could make inanimate things move
options.B: She could turn anything she touched to gold
options.C: She could make old people young again
options.D: She could change men into women
